page.title: 18GOVERNMENT
page.content: Over is part of{South Cambridgeshire {District Council}where it is rep- resented by Mr Clarence Wayman. 11 {Parish Councillors}are elected every 4 years. 40% voted an all male Council at the last elections. Mr Frank Hodson has been chairman for 11 years whilst the clerk, Mrs E. Pugh, is the only paid member. The public can attend the monthly meetings but are not permitted to speak except at the annual parish meeting. Agendas are displayed locally The clerk sends reports to the County Council and applies for repair work. The green, grass by the river and tree planting are P.C. responsibilities. {Over Town Lands Trust}has 9 members - vicar,church wardens,4 P.C.s - and owns the Town Hall, house, and village and fen land.Rents and interest are pooled, two thirds going to maintain the trust and to benefit the village.
